parameter.name: R
parameter.description: red component

parameter.name: G
parameter.description: green component

parameter.name: B
parameter.description: blue component

return.description: A new Color object.

parameter.name: R
parameter.description: red component

parameter.name: G
parameter.description: green component

parameter.name: B
parameter.description: blue component

parameter.name: A
parameter.description: alpha component (255 is opaque, 0 is invisible)

return.description: A new Color object.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: this color

return.description: A string showing the r, g, b, and a values of the color

function.name: EmitLightningArc
function.summary: Emit a lightning arc.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: (default Color(255, 255, 255))

parameter.name: lifetime
parameter.description: Lifetime in seconds. Clamped to [0, 4.233] for now because of strange internal maths. (default 1.0)

parameter.name: amplitude
parameter.description: "strength" of the lightning - the higher the value, the "taller" the arcs. Clamped to [1, 255]. (default 20)

parameter.name: beamWidth
parameter.description: Clamped to [1, 127]. (default 2)

parameter.name: detail
parameter.description: Higher numbers equal more segments, but it's not a 1:1 correlation. Clamped to [1, 127]. (default 10)

parameter.name: smooth
parameter.description: If true, the arc will have large, smooth curves; if false, it will have small, jagged spikes. (default false)

parameter.name: endDrift
parameter.description: If true, the end of the arc will be able to gradually drift away from its destination in a random direction (default false)

function.name: EmitParticle
function.summary: Emit a particle.
function.description: See the sprite editor in WadTool for DEFAULT_SPRITES to see a list of sprite indices.

parameter.name: spriteIndex
parameter.description: an index of a sprite in DEFAULT_SPRITES object.

parameter.name: gravity
parameter.description: (default 0) Specifies whether particle will fall (positive values) or ascend (negative values) over time. Clamped to [-32768, 32767], but values between -1000 and 1000 are recommended; values too high or too low (e.g. under -2000 or above 2000) will cause the velocity of the particle to "wrap around" and switch directions.

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: (default 0) specifies a speed with which it will rotate (0 = no rotation, negative = anticlockwise rotation, positive = clockwise rotation).

parameter.name: startColor
parameter.description: (default Color(255, 255, 255)) color at start of life

parameter.name: endColor
parameter.description: (default Color(255, 255, 255)) color to fade to - at the time of writing this fade will finish long before the end of the particle's life due to internal maths

parameter.name: blendMode
parameter.description: (default TEN.Effects.BlendID.ALPHABLEND) How will we blend this with its surroundings?

parameter.name: startSize
parameter.description: (default 10) Size on spawn. A value of 15 is approximately the size of Lara's head.

parameter.name: endSize
parameter.description: (default 0) Size on death - the particle will linearly shrink or grow to this size during its lifespan

parameter.name: lifetime
parameter.description: (default 2) Lifespan in seconds

parameter.name: damage
parameter.description: (default false) specifies whether particle can damage Lara (does a very small amount of damage, like the small lava emitters in TR1)

parameter.name: poison
parameter.description: (default false) specifies whether particle can poison Lara

function.name: EmitShockwave
function.summary: Emit a shockwave, similar to that seen when a harpy projectile hits something.

parameter.name: pos
parameter.description: Origin position

parameter.name: innerRadius
parameter.description: (default 0) Initial inner radius of the shockwave circle - 128 will be approx a click, 512 approx a block

parameter.name: outerRadius
parameter.description: (default 128) Initial outer radius of the shockwave circle

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: (default Color(255, 255, 255))

parameter.name: lifetime
parameter.description: (default 1.0) Lifetime in seconds (max 8.5 because of inner maths weirdness)

parameter.name: speed
parameter.description: (default 50) Initial speed of the shockwave's expansion (the shockwave will always slow as it goes)

parameter.name: angle
parameter.description: (default 0) Angle about the X axis - a value of 90 will cause the shockwave to be entirely vertical

parameter.name: hurtsLara
parameter.description: (default false) If true, the shockwave will hurt Lara, with the damage being relative to the shockwave's current speed

function.name: EmitLight
function.summary: Emit dynamic light that lasts for a single frame.
function.description: If you want a light that sticks around, you must call this each frame.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: (default Color(255, 255, 255))

parameter.name: radius
parameter.description: (default 20) corresponds loosely to both intensity and range

function.name: EmitBlood
function.summary: Emit blood.

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: (default 1) "amount" of blood. Higher numbers won't add more blood but will make it more "flickery", with higher numbers turning it into a kind of red orb.

function.name: EmitFire
function.summary: Emit fire for one frame.
function.description: Will not hurt Lara. Call this each frame if you want a continuous fire.

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: (default 1.0)

function.name: MakeExplosion
function.summary: Make an explosion.
function.description: Does not hurt Lara

parameter.name: size
parameter.description: (default 512.0) this will not be the size of the sprites, but rather the distance between the origin and any additional sprites

parameter.name: shockwave
parameter.description: (default false) if true, create a very faint white shockwave which will not hurt Lara

function.name: MakeEarthquake
function.summary: Make an earthquake

parameter.name: strength
parameter.description: (default 100) How strong should the earthquake be? Increasing this value also increases the lifespan of the earthquake.

function.name: FlashScreen
function.summary: Flash screen.

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: (default Color(255, 255, 255))

parameter.name: speed
parameter.description: (default 1.0). Speed in "amount" per second. A value of 1 will make the flash take one second. Clamped to [0.005, 1.0]

function.name: AddLevel
function.summary: Add a level to the Flow.

parameter.name: level
parameter.description: a level object

function.name: SetIntroImagePath
function.summary: Image to show when loading the game.
function.description: Must be a .jpg or .png image.

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: the path to the image, relative to the TombEngine exe

function.name: SetTitleScreenImagePath
function.summary: Image to show in the background of the title screen.
function.description: Must be a .jpg or .png image. __(not yet implemented)__

parameter.name: path
parameter.description: the path to the image, relative to the TombEngine exe

function.name: EnableLaraInTitle
function.summary: Enable or disable Lara drawing in title flyby.
function.description: Must be true or false

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: true or false

function.name: EnableLevelSelect
function.summary: Enable or disable level selection in title flyby.
function.description: Must be true or false

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: true or false

function.name: EnableFlyCheat
function.summary: Enable or disable DOZY mode (fly cheat).
function.description: Must be true or false

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: true or false

function.name: EnableMassPickup
function.summary: Enable or disable mass pickup.
function.description: Must be true or false

parameter.name: enabled
parameter.description: true or false

function.name: GetLevel
function.summary: Returns the level by index.
function.description: Indices depend on the order in which AddLevel was called; the first added will have an ID of 0, the second an ID of 1, and so on.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: of the level

return.description: the level indicated by the id

function.name: GetCurrentLevel
function.summary: Returns the level that the game control is running in that moment.

return.description: the current level

function.name: EndLevel
function.summary: Finishes the current level, with optional level index provided.
function.description: If level index is not provided or is zero, jumps to next level. If level index is more than level count, jumps to title.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: level index (default 0)

function.name: GetSecretCount
function.summary: Returns the player's current per-game secret count.

return.description: Current game secret count.

function.name: SetSecretCount
function.summary: Sets the player's current per-game secret count.

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: new secret count.

function.name: AddSecret
function.summary: Adds one secret to current level secret count and also plays secret music track.
function.description: The index argument corresponds to the secret's unique ID, the same that would go in a secret trigger's Param.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: an index of current level's secret (must be from 0 to 31).

function.name: SetTotalSecretCount
function.summary: Total number of secrets in game.
function.description: Must be an integer value (0 means no secrets).

parameter.name: total
parameter.description: number of secrets

parameter.name: settings
parameter.description: a settings object

parameter.name: animations
parameter.description: an animations object

function.name: SetStrings
function.summary: Set string variable keys and their translations.

parameter.name: table
parameter.description: array-style table with strings

function.name: GetString
function.summary: Get translated string

parameter.name: string
parameter.description: key for translated string

function.name: SetLanguageNames
function.summary: Set language names for translations.
function.description: Specify which translations in the strings table correspond to which languages.

parameter.name: table
parameter.description: array-style table with language names

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: RGB color

parameter.name: Min
parameter.description: Distance fog starts (in Sectors)

parameter.name: Max
parameter.description: Distance fog ends (in Sectors)

return.description: A fog object.

function.name: InventoryItem
function.summary: Create an InventoryItem.

parameter.name: nameKey
parameter.description:
key for the item's (localised) name.
Corresponds to an entry in strings.lua.

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: slot of inventory object to change

parameter.name: yOffset
parameter.description:
y-axis offset (positive values move the item down).
A value of about 100 will cause the item to display directly below its usual position.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description:
item size (1 being standard size).
A value of 0.5 will cause the item to render at half the size, and a value of 2 will cause the item to render at twice the size.

parameter.name: rot
parameter.description: rotation about x, y, and z axes

parameter.name: axis
parameter.description:
Axis to rotate about when the item is being looked at in the inventory.
Note that this is entirely separate from the `rot` field described above. Must one of the following: X Y Z e.g. `myItem.rotAxisWhenCurrent = RotationAxis.X`

parameter.name: meshBits
parameter.description: __Not currently implemented__ (will have no effect regardless of what you set it to)

parameter.name: action
parameter.description:
is this usable, equippable, combineable or examinable?
Must be one of: EQUIP USE COMBINE EXAMINE e.g. `myItem.action = ItemAction.EXAMINE`

return.description: an InventoryItem

function.name: Level
function.summary: Make a new Level object.

return.description: a Level object

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: RGB color

parameter.name: speed
parameter.description: cloud speed

return.description: A SkyLayer object.

function.name: GiveItem
function.summary: Add x of an item to the inventory.
function.description: Omitting the second argument will give the "default" amount of the item (i.e. the amount the player would get from a pickup of that type). For example, giving crossbow ammo without specifying the number would give the player 10 instead. Has no effect if the player has an infinite number of that item.

parameter.name: item
parameter.description: the item to be added

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: the number of items to add (default: the amount you would get from a pickup)

function.name: TakeItem
function.summary: Remove x of a certain item from the inventory.
function.description: As in @{GiveItem}, omitting the count will remove the "default" amount of that item. Has no effect if the player has an infinite number of the item.

parameter.name: item
parameter.description: the item to be removed

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: the number of items to remove (default: the amount you would get from a pickup)

function.name: GetItemCount
function.summary: Get the amount the player holds of an item.

parameter.name: item
parameter.description: the ID item to check

return.description: the amount of the item the player has in the inventory. -1 indicates an infinite amount of that item.

function.name: SetItemCount
function.summary: Set the amount of a certain item the player has in the inventory.
function.description: Similar to @{GiveItem} but replaces with the new amount instead of adding it.

parameter.name: item
parameter.description: the ID of the item to be set.

parameter.name: count
parameter.description: the number of items the player will have. A value of -1 will give an infinite amount of that item.

function.name: AddCallback
function.summary: Register a function as a callback.

parameter.name: CallbackPoint
parameter.description: When should the callback be called?

parameter.name: func
parameter.description: The function to be called (must be in the LevelFuncs hierarchy). Will receive, as an argument, the time in seconds since the last frame.

function.name: RemoveCallback
function.summary: Deregister a function as a callback.
function.description: Will have no effect if the function was not registered as a callback

parameter.name: CallbackPoint
parameter.description: The callback point the function was registered with. See @{AddCallback}

parameter.name: LevelFunc
parameter.description: the function to remove; must be in the LevelFuncs hierarchy.

function.name: HasLineOfSight
function.summary: Determine if there's a line of sight between two points.
function.description:
i.e. if we run a direct line from one position to another will any geometry get in the way?
Note: if you use this with Moveable:GetPosition to test if (for example) two creatures can see one another, you might have to do some extra adjustments.
This is because the "position" for most objects refers to its base, i.e., the floor. As a solution, you can increase the y-coordinate of this position to correspond to roughly where the eyes of the creatures would be.

parameter.name: room1
parameter.description: ID of the room where the first position is

parameter.name: pos1
parameter.description: first position

parameter.name: pos2
parameter.description: second position

return.description: is there a direct line of sight between the two positions?

function.name: Vibrate
function.summary: Vibrate game controller, if function is available and setting is on.

parameter.name: strength
parameter.description: Strength of the vibration

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: __(default 0.3)__ Time of the vibration, in seconds

function.name: FadeOut
function.summary: Do a full-screen fade-to-black.
function.description: The screen will remain black until a call to FadeIn.

parameter.name: speed
parameter.description: (default 1.0). Speed in "amount" per second. A value of 1 will make the fade take one second.

function.name: FadeIn
function.summary: Do a full-screen fade-in from black.

parameter.name: speed
parameter.description: (default 1.0). Speed in "amount" per second. A value of 1 will make the fade take one second.

function.name: SetCineBars
function.summary: Move black cinematic bars in from the top and bottom of the game window.

parameter.name: height
parameter.description: __(default 30)__ Percentage of the screen to be covered

parameter.name: speed
parameter.description: __(default 30)__ Coverage percent per second

function.name: SetFOV
function.summary: Set field of view.

parameter.name: angle
parameter.description: in degrees (clamped to [10, 170])

function.name: GetCameraType
function.summary: Shows the mode of the game camera.

return.description: value used by the Main Camera.

function.name: PlayAudioTrack
function.summary: Play an audio track

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: of track (without file extension) to play

parameter.name: loop
parameter.description: if true, the track will loop; if false, it won't (default: false)

function.name: SetAmbientTrack
function.summary: Set and play an ambient track

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: of track (without file extension) to play

function.name: StopAudioTracks
function.summary: Stop any audio tracks currently playing

function.name: StopAudioTrack
function.summary: Stop audio track that is currently playing

parameter.name: looped
parameter.description: if set, stop looped audio track, if not, stop one-shot audio track

function.name: PlaySound
function.summary: Play sound effect

parameter.name: sound
parameter.description: ID to play. Corresponds to the value in the sound XML file or Tomb Editor's "Sound Infos" window.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: The 3D position of the sound, i.e. where the sound "comes from". If not given, the sound will not be positional.

function.name: IsSoundPlaying
function.summary: Check if the sound effect is playing

parameter.name: Sound
parameter.description: ID to check. Corresponds to the value in the sound XML file or Tomb Editor's "Sound Infos" window.

function.name: FlipMap
function.summary: Do FlipMap with specific ID

parameter.name: flipmap
parameter.description: (ID of flipmap)

function.name: PlayFlyBy
function.summary: Enable FlyBy with specific ID

parameter.name: flyby
parameter.description: (ID of flyby)

function.name: CalculateDistance
function.summary: Calculate the distance between two positions.

parameter.name: posA
parameter.description: first position

parameter.name: posB
parameter.description: second position

return.description: the direct distance from one position to the other

function.name: CalculateHorizontalDistance
function.summary: Calculate the horizontal distance between two positions.

parameter.name: posA
parameter.description: first position

parameter.name: posB
parameter.description: second position

return.description: the direct distance on the XZ plane from one position to the other

function.name: PercentToScreen
function.summary: Translate a pair of percentages to screen-space pixel coordinates.
function.description: To be used with @{Strings.DisplayString:SetPosition} and @{Strings.DisplayString}.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: percent value to translate to x-coordinate

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: percent value to translate to y-coordinate

return.description: x coordinate in pixels
y coordinate in pixels

function.name: ScreenToPercent
function.summary: Translate a pair of coordinates to percentages of window dimensions.
function.description: To be used with @{Strings.DisplayString:GetPosition}.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: pixel value to translate to a percentage of the window width

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: pixel value to translate to a percentage of the window height

return.description: x coordinate as percentage
y coordinate as percentage

function.name: ResetObjCamera
function.summary: Reset object camera back to Lara and deactivate object camera.

function.name: Vibrate
function.summary: Vibrate gamepad, if possible.

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: (in seconds, default: 0.3)

function.name: KeyIsHeld
function.summary: Check if particular action key is held

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: action mapping index to check

function.name: KeyIsHit
function.summary: Check if particular action key was hit (once)

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: action mapping index to check

function.name: KeyPush
function.summary: Emulate pushing of a certain action key

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: action mapping index to push

function.name: KeyClear
function.summary: Clears particular input from action key

parameter.name: action
parameter.description: action mapping index to clear

function.name: GetPosition
function.summary: Get the object's position

return.description: a copy of the object's position

function.name: SetPosition
function.summary: Set the object's position

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: the new position of the object

function.name: GetRotationY
function.summary: Get the object's Y-axis rotation.
function.description: To the best of my knowledge, the rotation of an AIObject has no effect.

return.description: the object's Y-axis rotation

function.name: SetRotationY
function.summary: Set the object's Y-axis rotation.
function.description: To the best of my knowledge, the rotation of an AIObject has no effect.

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.description: The object's new Y-axis rotation

function.name: GetName
function.summary: Get the object's unique string identifier

return.description: the object's name

function.name: SetName
function.summary: Set the object's name (its unique string identifier)

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The object's new name

function.name: GetRoom
function.summary: Get the current room of the object

return.description: current room of the object

function.name: GetRoomNumber
function.summary: Get the current room number of the object

return.description: number representing the current room of the object

function.name: SetRoomNumber
function.summary: Set room number of the object This is used in conjunction with SetPosition to teleport the object to a new room.

parameter.name: ID
parameter.description: the ID of the new room

function.name: GetObjectID
function.summary: Retrieve the object ID

return.description: a number representing the ID of the object

function.name: SetObjectID
function.summary: Change the object's ID.
function.description: This will change the type of AI object it is. Note that a baddy will gain the behaviour of the tile it's on _before_ said baddy is triggered. This means that changing the type of an AI object beneath a moveable will have no effect. Instead, this function can be used to change an object that the baddy isn't standing on. For example, you could have a pair of AI_GUARD objects, and change one or the other two AI_PATROL_1 based on whether the player has a certain item or not.

parameter.name: ID
parameter.description: the new ID

function.name: GetPosition
function.summary: Get the camera's position

return.description: a copy of the camera's position

function.name: SetPosition
function.summary: Set the camera's position

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: the new position of the camera

function.name: GetName
function.summary: Get the camera's unique string identifier

return.description: the camera's name

function.name: SetName
function.summary: Set the camera's name (its unique string identifier)

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The camera's new name

function.name: GetRoom
function.summary: Get the current room of the camera

return.description: current room of the camera

function.name: GetRoomNumber
function.summary: Get the current room number of the camera

return.description: number representing the current room of the camera

function.name: SetRoomNumber
function.summary: Set room of camera This is used in conjunction with SetPosition to teleport the camera to a new room.

parameter.name: ID
parameter.description: the ID of the new room

function.name: PlayCamera
function.summary: Active the camera during that frame.

parameter.name: Target
parameter.description: If you put a moveable, the camera will look at it. Otherwise, it will look at Lara.

function.name: SetPoison
function.summary: Set Lara poison

parameter.name: Poison
parameter.description: ; maximum value is 128 (default 0)

function.name: GetPoison
function.summary: Get poison potency of Lara

return.description: current poison potency

function.name: SetAir
function.summary: Set air value of Lara

parameter.name: Air
parameter.description: value to give Lara. Maximum value is 1800.

function.name: GetAir
function.summary: Get air value of Lara

return.description: current air value

function.name: SetWet
function.summary: Set wetness value of Lara (causes dripping)

parameter.name: Wetness
parameter.description: value. Maximum 255

function.name: GetWet
function.summary: Get wetness value of Lara

return.description: current wetness value

function.name: SetStamina
function.summary: Set sprint energy value of Lara

parameter.name: stamina
parameter.description: to give to Lara; maximum value is 120.

function.name: GetStamina
function.summary: Get stamina value of Lara

return.description: current sprint value

function.name: GetAirborne
function.summary: Get the moveable's airborne status

return.description: true if Lara state must react to aerial forces.

function.name: SetAirborne
function.summary: Set the moveable's airborne status

parameter.name: New
parameter.description: airborn status for Lara.

function.name: UndrawWeapon
function.summary: Lara will undraw her weapon if it is drawn and throw away a flare if she is currently holding one.

function.name: ThrowAwayTorch
function.summary: Lara will throw away the torch if she currently holds one in her hand.

function.name: GetHandStatus
function.summary: Get actual hand status of Lara

return.description: hand status 0=HandsFree, 1=Busy(climbing,etc), 2=WeaponDraw, 3=WeaponUndraw, 4=WeaponInHand.

function.name: GetWeaponType
function.summary: Get actual weapon type of Lara

return.description: weapon type 0=None, 1=Pistols, 2=Revolver, 3=Uzi, 4=Shotgun, 5=HK, 6=Crossbow, 7=Flare, 8=Torch, 9=GrenadeLauncher, 10=Harpoon, 11=RocketLauncher.

function.name: SetWeaponType
function.summary: Set Lara weapon type

parameter.name: weaponType
parameter.description: Must be one of: NONE PISTOLS REVOLVER UZI SHOTGUN HK CROSSBOW FLARE TORCH GRENADELAUNCHER HARPOONGUN ROCKETLAUNCHER

parameter.name: activate
parameter.description: true = let her also draw the weapons, set torch lit. false = let Laras new weapons remain holstered until she draws them, set torch unlit.

function.name: GetAmmoCount
function.summary: Get current weapon's ammo count

return.description: current ammo count (-1 if infinite)

function.name: GetVehicle
function.summary: Get current vehicle, if it exists

return.description: current vehicle (nil if no vehicle present)

function.name: GetTarget
function.summary: Get current target enemy, if it exists

return.description: current target enemy (nil if no target present)

function.name: TorchIsLit
function.summary: Get current light state of the torch, if it exists

return.description: is torch currently lit or not? (false if no torch exists)

function.name: Moveable
function.summary: For more information on each parameter, see the associated getters and setters.
function.description: If you do not know what to set for these, most can just be ignored (see usage).

parameter.name: object
parameter.description: ID

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Lua name of the item

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: position in level

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.description: rotation about x, y, and z axes (default Rotation(0, 0, 0))

parameter.name: room
parameter.description: room ID item is in (default: calculated automatically)

parameter.name: animNumber
parameter.description: anim number

parameter.name: frameNumber
parameter.description: frame number

parameter.name: hp
parameter.description: HP of item

parameter.name: OCB
parameter.description: ocb of item (default 0)

parameter.name: AIBits
parameter.description: table with AI bits (default {0,0,0,0,0,0})

return.description: A new Moveable object (a wrapper around the new object)

function.name: Explode
function.summary: Explode item.
function.description: This also kills and disables item.

function.name: Shatter
function.summary: Shatter item.
function.description: This also kills and disables item.

function.name: SetEffect
function.summary: Set effect to moveable

parameter.name: effect
parameter.description: Type of effect to assign.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: time (in seconds) after which effect turns off (optional).

function.name: SetCustomEffect
function.summary: Set custom colored burn effect to moveable

parameter.name: Color1
parameter.description: color the primary color of the effect (also used for lighting).

parameter.name: Color2
parameter.description: color the secondary color of the effect.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.description: time (in seconds) after which effect turns off (optional).

function.name: GetEffect
function.summary: Get current moveable effect

return.description: effect type currently assigned to moveable.

function.name: GetStatus
function.summary: Get the status of object.
function.description:
possible values:
0 - not active
1 - active
2 - deactivated
3 - invisible

return.description: a number representing the status of the object

function.name: SetOnHit
function.summary: Set the name of the function to be called when the moveable is shot by Lara.
function.description: Note that this will be triggered twice when shot with both pistols at once.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: function in LevelFuncs hierarchy to call when moveable is shot

function.name: SetOnKilled
function.summary: Set the name of the function to be called when the moveable is destroyed/killed Note that enemy death often occurs at the end of an animation, and not at the exact moment the enemy's HP becomes zero.

parameter.name: callback
parameter.description: function in LevelFuncs hierarchy to call when enemy is killed

function.name: GetObjectID
function.summary: Retrieve the object ID

return.description: a number representing the ID of the object

function.name: SetObjectID
function.summary: Change the object's ID.
function.description: This will literally change the object.

parameter.name: ID
parameter.description: the new ID

function.name: GetState
function.summary: Retrieve the index of the current state.
function.description: This corresponds to the number shown in the item's state ID field in WadTool.

return.description: the index of the active state

function.name: SetState
function.summary: Set the object's state to the one specified by the given index.
function.description: Performs no bounds checking. *Ensure the number given is correct, else object may end up in corrupted animation state.*

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: the index of the desired state

function.name: GetAnim
function.summary: Retrieve the index of the current animation.
function.description: This corresponds to the number shown in the item's animation list in WadTool.

return.description: the index of the active animation

function.name: SetAnim
function.summary: Set the object's animation to the one specified by the given index.
function.description: Performs no bounds checking. *Ensure the number given is correct, else object may end up in corrupted animation state.*

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: the index of the desired anim

function.name: GetFrame
function.summary: Retrieve frame number.
function.description: This is the current frame of the object's active animation.

return.description: the current frame of the active animation

function.name: SetVelocity
function.summary: Set the object's velocity to specified value.
function.description: In most cases, only Z and Y components are used as forward and vertical velocity. In some cases, primarily NPCs, X component is used as side velocity.

parameter.name: velocity
parameter.description: velocity represented as vector

function.name: GetVelocity
function.summary: Get the object's velocity.
function.description: In most cases, only Z and Y components are used as forward and vertical velocity. In some cases, primarily NPCs, X component is used as side velocity.

return.description: current object velocity

function.name: SetFrame
function.summary: Set frame number.
function.description: This will move the animation to the given frame. The number of frames in an animation can be seen under the heading "End frame" in the WadTool animation editor. If the animation has no frames, the only valid argument is -1.

parameter.name: frame
parameter.description: the new frame number

function.name: GetSlotHP
function.summary: Get HP definded for that object type (hit points/health points) (Read Only).

parameter.name: ID
parameter.description: of the moveable slot type.

function.name: GetOCB
function.summary: Get OCB (object code bit) of the moveable

return.description: the moveable's current OCB value

function.name: SetOCB
function.summary: Set OCB (object code bit) of the moveable

parameter.name: OCB
parameter.description: the new value for the moveable's OCB

function.name: GetItemFlags
function.summary: Get the value stored in ItemFlags[index]

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: of the ItemFlags, can be between 0 and 7.

return.description: the value contained in the ItemFlags[index]

function.name: SetItemFlags
function.summary: Stores a value in ItemFlags[index]

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: to store in the moveable's ItemFlags[index]

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: of the ItemFlags where store the value.

function.name: GetColor
function.summary: Get the moveable's color

return.description: a copy of the moveable's color

function.name: SetColor
function.summary: Set the moveable's color

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: the new color of the moveable

function.name: GetHitStatus
function.summary: Get the hit status of the object

return.description: true if the moveable was hit by something in the last gameplay frame, false otherwise

function.name: GetActive
function.summary: Determine whether the moveable is active or not

return.description: true if the moveable is active

function.name: GetJointPosition
function.summary: Get the object's joint position

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: of a joint to get position

return.description: a copy of the moveable's position

function.name: GetRotation
function.summary: Get the moveable's rotation

return.description: a copy of the moveable's rotation

function.name: SetRotation
function.summary: Set the moveable's rotation

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.description: The moveable's new rotation

function.name: GetName
function.summary: Get the moveable's name (its unique string identifier) e.g.
function.description: "door\_back\_room" or "cracked\_greek\_statue" This corresponds with the "Lua Name" field in an object's properties in Tomb Editor.

return.description: the moveable's name

function.name: SetName
function.summary: Set the moveable's name (its unique string identifier) e.g.
function.description: "door\_back\_room" or "cracked\_greek\_statue" It cannot be blank and cannot share a name with any existing object.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the new moveable's name

return.description: true if we successfully set the name, false otherwise (e.g. if another object has the name already)

function.name: GetValid
function.summary: Test if the object is in a valid state (i.e.
function.description: has not been destroyed through Lua or killed by Lara).

return.description: valid true if the object is still not destroyed

function.name: Destroy
function.summary: Destroy the moveable.
function.description: This will mean it can no longer be used, except to re-initialise it with another object.

function.name: AttachObjCamera
function.summary: Attach camera to an object.

parameter.name: mesh
parameter.description: of a target moveable to use as a camera target

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: moveable to attach camera to

parameter.name: mesh
parameter.description: of a target moveable to use as a camera target

function.name: AnimFromObject
function.summary: Borrow animation from an object

parameter.name: ObjectID
parameter.description: to take animation and stateID from,

parameter.name: animNumber
parameter.description: animation from object

parameter.name: stateID
parameter.description: state from object

function.name: SetOnCollidedWithObject
function.summary: Set the function to be called when this moveable collides with another moveable

parameter.name: func
parameter.description: callback function to be called (must be in LevelFuncs hierarchy). This function can take two arguments; these will store the two @{Moveable}s taking part in the collision.

function.name: SetOnCollidedWithRoom
function.summary: Set the function called when this moveable collides with room geometry (e.g.
function.description: a wall or floor). This function can take an argument that holds the @{Moveable} that collided with geometry.

parameter.name: func
parameter.description: callback function to be called (must be in LevelFuncs hierarchy)

function.name: GetPosition
function.summary: Get the object's position

return.description: a copy of the moveable's position

function.name: SetPosition
function.summary: Set the moveable's position If you are moving a moveable whose behaviour involves knowledge of room geometry, (e.g.
function.description: a BADDY1, which uses it for pathfinding), then the second argument should be true (or omitted, as true is the default). Otherwise, said moveable will not behave correctly.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: the new position of the moveable

parameter.name: updateRoom
parameter.description: Will room changes be automatically detected? Set to false if you are using overlapping rooms (default: true)

function.name: GetHP
function.summary: Get current HP (hit points/health points)

return.description: the amount of HP the moveable currently has

function.name: SetHP
function.summary: Set current HP (hit points/health points) Clamped to [0, 32767] for "intelligent" entities (i.e.
function.description: anything with AI); clamped to [-32767, 32767] otherwise.

parameter.name: HP
parameter.description: the amount of HP to give the moveable

function.name: GetLocationAI
function.summary: Get the location value stored in the Enemy AI

return.description: the value contained in the LocationAI of the creature.

function.name: SetLocationAI
function.summary: Updates the location in the enemy AI with the given value.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: to store.

function.name: GetAIBits
function.summary: Get AIBits of object This will return a table with six values, each corresponding to an active behaviour.
function.description:
If the object is in a certain AI mode, the table will have a *1* in the corresponding cell. Otherwise, the cell will hold a *0*.
1 - guard
2 - ambush
3 - patrol 1
4 - modify
5 - follow
6 - patrol 2

return.description: a table of AI bits

function.name: SetAIBits
function.summary: Set AIBits of object Use this to force a moveable into a certain AI mode or modes, as if a certain nullmesh (or more than one) had suddenly spawned beneath their feet.

parameter.name: bits
parameter.description: the table of AI bits

function.name: GetRoom
function.summary: Get the current room of the object

return.description: current room of the object

function.name: GetRoomNumber
function.summary: Get the current room number of the object

return.description: number representing the current room of the object

function.name: SetRoomNumber
function.summary: Set room number of object Use this if you are not using SetPosition's automatic room update - for example, when dealing with overlapping rooms.

parameter.name: ID
parameter.description: the ID of the new room

function.name: GetMeshVisible
function.summary: Get state of specified mesh visibility of object Returns true if specified mesh is visible on an object, and false if it is not visible.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of a mesh

return.description: visibility status

function.name: SetMeshVisible
function.summary: Makes specified mesh visible or invisible Use this to show or hide a specified mesh of an object.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of a mesh

parameter.name: visible
parameter.description: true if you want the mesh to be visible, false otherwise

function.name: ShatterMesh
function.summary: Shatters specified mesh and makes it invisible Note that you can re-enable mesh later by using SetMeshVisible().

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of a mesh

function.name: GetMeshSwapped
function.summary: Get state of specified mesh swap of object Returns true if specified mesh is swapped on an object, and false if it is not swapped.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of a mesh

return.description: mesh swap status

function.name: SwapMesh
function.summary: Set state of specified mesh swap of object Use this to swap specified mesh of an object.

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of a mesh

parameter.name: slotIndex
parameter.description: index of a slot to get meshswap from

parameter.name: swapIndex
parameter.description: index of a mesh from meshswap slot to use

function.name: UnswapMesh
function.summary: Set state of specified mesh swap of object Use this to bring back original unswapped mesh

parameter.name: index
parameter.description: index of a mesh to unswap

function.name: Enable
function.summary: Enable the item, as if a trigger for it had been stepped on.

function.name: Disable
function.summary: Disable the item, as if an antitrigger for it had been stepped on (i.e.
function.description: it will close an open door or extinguish a flame emitter). Note that this will not trigger an OnKilled callback.

function.name: MakeInvisible
function.summary: Make the item invisible.
function.description: Alias for `Moveable:SetVisible(false)`.

function.name: SetVisible
function.summary: Set the item's visibility.
function.description: __An invisible item will have collision turned off, as if it no longer exists in the game world__.

parameter.name: visible
parameter.description: true if the caller should become visible, false if it should become invisible

function.name: GetMoveableByName
function.summary: Get a moveable by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the unique name of the Moveable as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor

return.description: a non-owning Moveable referencing the item.

function.name: GetStaticByName
function.summary: Get a Static by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the unique name of the mesh as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor

return.description: a non-owning Static referencing the mesh.

function.name: GetMoveablesBySlot
function.summary: Get moveables by its slot.

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: the unique slot of the Moveable, e.g. `Objects.ObjID.ANIMATING1`

return.description: table of Moveables referencing the given slot.

function.name: GetStaticsBySlot
function.summary: Get statics by its slot.

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: the unique slot of the mesh like 10

return.description: table of Statics referencing the given slot ID.

function.name: GetRoomsByTag
function.summary: Get rooms by tag.

parameter.name: tag
parameter.description: to select rooms by

return.description: table of Rooms containing the given tag.

function.name: GetCameraByName
function.summary: Get a Camera by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the unique name of the camera as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor

return.description: a non-owning Camera referencing the camera.

function.name: GetSinkByName
function.summary: Get a Sink by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the unique name of the sink as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor

return.description: a non-owning Sink referencing the sink.

function.name: GetSoundSourceByName
function.summary: Get a SoundSource by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the unique name of the sound source as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor

return.description: a non-owning SoundSource referencing the sound source.

function.name: GetAIObjectByName
function.summary: Get an AIObject by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the unique name of the AIObject as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor

return.description: a non-owning SoundSource referencing the AI moveable.

function.name: GetVolumeByName
function.summary: Get a Volume by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the unique name of the volume as set in, or generated by, Tomb Editor

return.description: a non-owning Volume referencing the room.

function.name: GetRoomByName
function.summary: Get a Room by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: the unique name of the room as set in Tomb Editor

return.description: a non-owning Room referencing the room.

function.name: GetActive
function.summary: Determine whether the room is active or not

return.description: true if the room is active

function.name: GetReverbType
function.summary: Get the room's reverb type.

return.description: room's reverb type

function.name: SetReverbType
function.summary: Set the room's reverb type.

parameter.name: new
parameter.description: reverb type of the room

function.name: GetName
function.summary: Get the room's unique string identifier.

return.description: the room's name

function.name: SetName
function.summary: Set the room's name (its unique string identifier).

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The room's new name

function.name: GetFlag
function.summary: Get the room's specified flag value (true or false).

parameter.name: flagID
parameter.description: The room's flag ID

return.description: the room's specified flag value

function.name: SetFlag
function.summary: Set the room's specified flag value.

parameter.name: flagID
parameter.description: The room's flag ID

parameter.name: the
parameter.description: room's new flag value

function.name: IsTagPresent
function.summary: Checks if specified tag is set for this room.

parameter.name: tag
parameter.description: A text tag to check (case sensitive)

return.description: true if tag is present, false if not

function.name: GetPosition
function.summary: Get the sink's position

return.description: a copy of the sink's position

function.name: SetPosition
function.summary: Set the sink's position

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: the new position of the sink

function.name: GetName
function.summary: Get the sink's unique string identifier e.g.
function.description: "strong\_river\_current" or "propeller\_death\_sink"

return.description: the sink's name

function.name: SetName
function.summary: Set the sink's name (its unique string identifier)

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The sink's new name

function.name: GetStrength
function.summary: Get the sink's strength

return.description: the sink's current strength

function.name: SetStrength
function.summary: Set the strength of the sink Higher numbers provide stronger currents.
function.description: Will be clamped to [1, 32].

parameter.name: strength
parameter.description: The sink's new strength

function.name: GetPosition
function.summary: Get the sound source's position

return.description: a copy of the sound source's position

function.name: SetPosition
function.summary: Set the sound source's position

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: the new position of the sound source

function.name: GetName
function.summary: Get the sound source's unique string identifier

return.description: the sound source's name

function.name: SetName
function.summary: Set the sound source's name (its unique string identifier)

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The sound source's new name

function.name: GetSoundID
function.summary: Get the sound source's unique int identifier

return.description: the ID of the sound

function.name: SetSoundID
function.summary: Set the sound source's ID __TODO__ this and getSoundID should use enums

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The sound source's new name

function.name: Enable
function.summary: Enable the static, for cases when it was shattered or manually disabled before.

function.name: Disable
function.summary: Disable the static

function.name: GetActive
function.summary: Get static mesh visibility

return.description: visibility state

function.name: GetSolid
function.summary: Get static mesh solid collision state

return.description: solid collision state (true if solid, false if soft)

function.name: SetSolid
function.summary: Set static mesh solid collision state

parameter.name: solidState
parameter.description: if set, collision will be solid, if not, will be soft

function.name: GetPosition
function.summary: Get the static's position

return.description: a copy of the static's position

function.name: SetPosition
function.summary: Set the static's position

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: the new position of the static

function.name: GetRotation
function.summary: Get the static's rotation

return.description: a copy of the static's rotation

function.name: SetRotation
function.summary: Set the static's rotation

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.description: the static's new rotation

function.name: GetScale
function.summary: Get the static's scale

return.description: current static scale

function.name: SetScale
function.summary: Set the static's scale

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: the static's new scale

function.name: GetName
function.summary: Get the static's unique string identifier

return.description: the static's name

function.name: SetName
function.summary: Set the static's name (its unique string identifier) e.g.
function.description: "my\_vase" or "oldrubble"

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The static's new name

function.name: GetSlot
function.summary: Get the static's slot number (as listed in Tomb Editor and WadTool)

return.description: the static's slot number

function.name: SetSlot
function.summary: Set the static's slot number (as listed in Tomb Editor and WadTool)

parameter.name: slot
parameter.description: The static's slot number

function.name: GetColor
function.summary: Get the static's color

return.description: a copy of the static's color

function.name: SetColor
function.summary: Set the static's color

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: the new color of the static

function.name: Shatter
function.summary: Shatter static mesh

function.name: Enable
function.summary: Enable the volume.

function.name: Disable
function.summary: Disable the volume.

function.name: GetActive
function.summary: Determine whether the volume is active or not

return.description: true if the volume is active

function.name: GetPosition
function.summary: Get the volume's position.

return.description: a copy of the volume's position

function.name: SetPosition
function.summary: Set the volume's position.

parameter.name: position
parameter.description: the new position of the volume

function.name: GetRotation
function.summary: Get the volume's rotation.

return.description: a copy of the volume's rotation

function.name: SetRotation
function.summary: Set the volume's rotation.

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.description: the volume's new rotation

function.name: GetScale
function.summary: Get the volume's scale (separately on all 3 axes).

return.description: current volume scale

function.name: SetScale
function.summary: Set the volume's scale (separately on all 3 axes).

parameter.name: scale
parameter.description: the volume's new scale

function.name: GetName
function.summary: Get the volume's unique string identifier.

return.description: the volume's name

function.name: SetName
function.summary: Set the volume's name (its unique string identifier).

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The volume's new name

function.name: ClearActivators
function.summary: Clear activator list for volumes (makes volume trigger everything again)

function.name: IsMoveableInside
function.summary: Check if specified moveable is inside the volume

parameter.name: Moveable
parameter.description: which should be checked for containment

return.description: state of the moveable, true if contained, false if not

parameter.name: X
parameter.description: rotation about x axis

parameter.name: Y
parameter.description: rotation about y axis

parameter.name: Z
parameter.description: rotation about z axis

return.description: A Rotation object.

parameter.name: rotation
parameter.description: this rotation

return.description: A string showing the x, y, and z values of the rotation

function.name: DisplayString
function.summary: Create a DisplayString.
function.description: For use in @{Strings.ShowString|ShowString} and @{Strings.HideString|HideString}.

parameter.name: str
parameter.description: string to print or key of translated string

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: x-coordinate of top-left of string (or the center if DisplayStringOption.CENTER is given)

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: y-coordinate of top-left of string (or the center if DisplayStringOption.CENTER is given)

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: the color of the text

parameter.name: translated
parameter.description: if false or omitted, the str argument will be printed. If true, the str argument will be the key of a translated string specified in strings.lua. __Default: false__.

parameter.name: flags
parameter.description: a table of display options. Can be empty or omitted. The possible values and their effects are... TEN.Strings.DisplayStringOption.CENTER -- see x and y parameters TEN.Strings.DisplayStringOption.SHADOW -- will give the text a small shadow __Default: empty__

return.description: A new DisplayString object.

function.name: GetColor
function.summary: Get the display string's color

return.description: a copy of the display string's color

function.name: SetColor
function.summary: Set the display string's color

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: the new color of the display string

function.name: GetKey
function.summary: Get the string key to use.

return.description: a string

function.name: SetKey
function.summary: Set the string key to use.

parameter.name: string
parameter.description: the new key for the display string

function.name: SetPosition
function.summary: Set the position of the string.
function.description: Screen-space coordinates are expected.

parameter.name: x
parameter.description: x-coordinate of the string

parameter.name: y
parameter.description: y-coordinate of the string

function.name: GetPosition
function.summary: Get the position of the string.
function.description: Screen-space coordinates are returned.

return.description: x x-coordinate of the string
y y-coordinate of the string

function.name: ShowString
function.summary: Show some text on-screen.

parameter.name: str
parameter.description: the string object to draw

parameter.name: time
parameter.description: the time in seconds for which to show the string. If not given, the string will have an "infinite" life, and will show until @{HideString} is called or until the level is finished. Default: nil (i.e. infinite)

function.name: HideString
function.summary: Hide some on-screen text.

parameter.name: str
parameter.description: the string object to hide. Must previously have been shown with a call to @{ShowString}, or this function will have no effect.

function.name: GetNormalised
function.summary: Modify this vector so that it becomes close to the requested length.
function.description: Note that since the engine uses integers instead of floating-point numbers, this will be less accurate at smaller lengths. For example, if you have the vector (100, 600, 700) and set it to the length of 1, the vector SHOULD become approximately (0.11, 0.65, 0.75). However, this function would return it as (0, 1, 1).

parameter.name: length
parameter.description: the new length to set the vector to.

parameter.name: X
parameter.description: x coordinate

parameter.name: Y
parameter.description: y coordinate

parameter.name: Z
parameter.description: z coordinate

return.description: A Vec3 object.

function.name: tostring
function.summary: Metafunction; use tostring(myVector)

parameter.name: Vec3
parameter.description: this Vec3

return.description: A string showing the x, y, and z values of the Vec3

function.name: Create
function.summary: Create (but do not start) a new event sequence.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: A label to give the sequence; used to retrieve the timer later as well as internally by TEN.

parameter.name: loop
parameter.description: if true, the sequence will start again from its first timer once its final function has been called

parameter.name: timerFormat
parameter.description: same as in Timer. This is mainly for debugging. __This will not work properly if another sequence or timer is showing a countdown.__

a variable number of pairs of arguments - a time in seconds, followed by the function (must be defined in the LevelFuncs table) to call once the time has elapsed, followed by another duration in seconds, another function name, etc. You can specify a function either by its name as a string, or by a table with the function name as the first member, followed by its arguments (see above example).

return.description: The inactive sequence.

function.name: Get
function.summary: Get an event sequence by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The label that was given to the sequence when it was created

return.description: The sequence

function.name: SetPaused
function.summary: Pause or unpause the sequence.
function.description: If showing the remaining time on-screen, its color will be set to yellow (paused) or white (unpaused).

parameter.name: p
parameter.description: if true, the sequence will be paused; if false, it will be unpaused

function.name: IsPaused
function.summary: Get whether or not the sequence is paused

return.description: true if the timer is paused, false if otherwise

function.name: Start
function.summary: Begin or unpause a sequence.
function.description: If showing the remaining time on-screen, its color will be set to white.

function.name: Stop
function.summary: Stop the sequence.

function.name: IsActive
function.summary: Get whether or not the sequence is active

return.description: true if the sequence is active, false if otherwise

function.name: Create
function.summary: Create (but do not start) a new timer.
function.description: You have the option of displaying the remaining time on the clock. Timer format details:

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: A label to give this timer; used to retrieve the timer later. __Do not give your timers a name beginning with __TEN, as this is reserved for timers used by other internal libaries__.

parameter.name: totalTime
parameter.description: The duration of the timer, in seconds

parameter.name: loop
parameter.description: if true, the timer will start again immediately after the time has elapsed

parameter.name: timerFormat
parameter.description: If a table is given, the remaining time will be shown as a string, formatted according to the values in the table. If true, the remaining seconds, rounded up, will show at the bottom of the screen. If false, the remaining time will not be shown on screen.

parameter.name: func
parameter.description: The LevelFunc function to call when the time is up
a variable number of arguments with which the above function will be called

return.description: The timer in its paused state

function.name: Get
function.summary: Get a timer by its name.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The label that was given to the timer when it was created

return.description: The timer

function.name: SetFunction
function.summary: Give the timer a new function and args

parameter.name: func
parameter.description: The LevelFunc member to call when the time is up
a variable number of arguments with which the above function will be called

function.name: Start
function.summary: Begin or unpause a timer.
function.description: If showing the remaining time on-screen, its color will be set to white.

function.name: Stop
function.summary: Stop the timer.

function.name: IsActive
function.summary: Get whether or not the timer is active

return.description: true if the timer is active, false if otherwise

function.name: SetPaused
function.summary: Pause or unpause the timer.
function.description: If showing the remaining time on-screen, its color will be set to yellow (paused) or white (unpaused).

parameter.name: p
parameter.description: if true, the timer will be paused; if false, it would be unpaused

function.name: IsPaused
function.summary: Get whether or not the timer is paused

return.description: true if the timer is paused, false if otherwise

function.name: GetRemainingTime
function.summary: Get the remaining time for a timer.

return.description: the time in seconds remaining on the clock

function.name: SetRemainingTime
function.summary: Set the remaining time for a timer

parameter.name: remainingTime
parameter.description: the new time remaining for the timer

function.name: GetRemainingTime
function.summary: Get the total time for a timer.
function.description: This is the amount of time the timer will start with, as well as when starting a new loop

return.description: the timer's total time

function.name: SetTotalTime
function.summary: Set the total time for a timer

parameter.name: totalTime
parameter.description: timer's new total time

function.name: SetLooping
function.summary: Set whether or not the timer loops

parameter.name: looping
parameter.description: whether or not the timer loops
